00022   using namespace std;
00023 
00024   const Math::real SphericalEngine::scale_ =
00025     pow(real(numeric_limits<real>::radix),
00026         -numeric_limits<real>::max_exponent/2);
00027   const Math::real SphericalEngine::eps_ =
00028     Math::sq(numeric_limits<real>::epsilon());
00029 
00030   const std::vector<Math::real> SphericalEngine::Z_(0);
00031 
00032   template<bool gradp, SphericalEngine::normalization norm, int L>
00033   Math::real SphericalEngine::Value(const coeff c[], const real f[],
00034                                     real x, real y, real z, real a,
00035                                     real& gradx, real& grady, real& gradz)
00036     throw() {
00037     // General sum
00038     // V(r, theta, lambda) = sum(n = 0..N) sum(m = 0..n)
00039     //   q^(n+1) * (C[n,m] * cos(m*lambda) + S[n,m] * sin(m*lambda)) * P[n,m](t)
00040     //
00041     // write t = cos(theta), u = sin(theta), q = a/r.
00042     //
00043     // P[n,m] is the fully normalized associated Legendre function (usually
00044     // denoted Pbar) of degree n and order m.
00045     //
00046     // Rewrite outer sum
00047     // V(r, theta, lambda) = sum(m = 0..N) * P[m,m](t) * q^(m+1) *
00048     //    [Sc[m] * cos(m*lambda) + Ss[m] * sin(m*lambda)]
00049     // = "outer sum"
00050     //
00051     // where the inner sums are
00052     //   Sc[m] = sum(n = m..N) q^(n-m) * C[n,m] * P[n,m](t)/P[m,m](t)
00053     //   Ss[m] = sum(n = m..N) q^(n-m) * S[n,m] * P[n,m](t)/P[m,m](t)
00054     //
00055     // Evaluate sums via Clenshaw method.
00056     //
00057     // The overall framework is similar to Deakin with the following changes:
00058     // * use fully normalized associated Legendre functions (instead of the
00059     //   quasi-normalized ones)
00060     // * Clenshaw summation is used to roll the computation of cos(m*lambda)
00061     //   and sin(m*lambda) into the evaluation of the outer sum (rather than
00062     //   independently computing an array of these trigonometric terms).
00063     // * Scale the coefficients to guard against overflow when N is large.
00064     //
00065     // General framework of Clenshaw;   see
00066     //    http://mathworld.wolfram.com/ClenshawRecurrenceFormula.html
00067     //
00068     // Let
00069     //    S = sum(k = 0..N) c[k] * F[k](x)
00070     //    F[n+1](x) = alpha[n](x) * F[n](x) + beta[n](x) * F[n-1](x)
00071     //
00072     // Evaluate S with
00073     //    y[N+2] = y[N+1] = 0
00074     //    y[k] = alpha[k] * y[k+1] + beta[k+1] * y[k+2] + c[k]
00075     //    S = c[0] * F[0] + y[1] * F[1] + beta[1] * F[0] * y[2]
00076     //
00077     // IF F[0](x) = 1 and beta(0,x) = 0, then F[1](x) = alpha(0,x) and
00078     // we can continue the recursion for y[k] until y[0]:
00079     //    S = y[0]
00080     //
00081     // Inner sum...
00082     //
00083     // let l = n-m; n = l+m
00084     // Sc[m] = sum(l = 0..N-m) C[l+m,m] * q^l * P[l+m,m](t)/P[m,m](t)
00085     // F[l] = q^l * P[l+m,m](t)/P[m,m](t)
00086     //
00087     // Holmes + Featherstone, Eq. (11):
00088     //   P[n,m] = sqrt((2*n-1)*(2*n+1)/((n-m)*(n+m))) * t * P[n-1,m] -
00089     //            sqrt((2*n+1)*(n+m-1)*(n-m-1)/((n-m)*(n+m)*(2*n-3))) * P[n-2,m]
00090     // thus
00091     //   alpha[l] = t * q * sqrt(((2*n+1)*(2*n+3))/
00092     //                           ((n-m+1)*(n+m+1)))
00093     //   beta[l+1] = - q^2 * sqrt(((n-m+1)*(n+m+1)*(2*n+5))/
00094     //                            ((n-m+2)*(n+m+2)*(2*n+1)))
00095     //
00096     // In this case, F[0] = 1 and beta[0] = 0 so the Sc[m] = y[0].
00097     //
00098     // Outer sum...
00099     //
00100     // V = sum(m = 0..N) Sc[m] * q^(m+1) * cos(m*lambda) * P[m,m](t)
00101     //   + sum(m = 0..N) Ss[m] * q^(m+1) * cos(m*lambda) * P[m,m](t)
00102     // F[m] = q^(m+1) * cos(m*lambda) * P[m,m](t) [or sin(m*lambda)]
00103     //
00104     // Holmes + Featherstone, Eq. (13):
00105     //   P[m,m] = u * sqrt((2*m+1)/((m>1?2:1)*m)) * P[m-1,m-1]
00106     // and
00107     //   cos((m+1)*lambda) = 2*cos(lambda)*cos(m*lambda) - cos((m-1)*lambda)
00108     // thus
00109     //   alpha[m] = 2*cos(lambda) * sqrt((2*m+3)/(2*(m+1))) * u * q
00110     //            =   cos(lambda) * sqrt( 2*(2*m+3)/(m+1) ) * u * q
00111     //   beta[m+1] = -sqrt((2*m+3)*(2*m+5)/(4*(m+1)*(m+2))) * u^2 * q^2
00112     //               * (m == 0 ? sqrt(2) : 1)
00113     //
00114     // F[0] = q                                [or 0]
00115     // F[1] = cos(lambda) * sqrt(3) * u * q^2  [or sin(lambda)]
00116     // beta[1] = - sqrt(15/4) * u^2 * q^2
00117     //
00118     // Here is how the various components of the gradient are computed
00119     //
00120     // differentiate wrt r:
00121     //   d q^(n+1) / dr = (-1/r) * (n+1) * q^(n+1)
00122     //
00123     // so multiply C[n,m] by n+1 in inner sum and multiply the sum by -1/r.
00124     //
00125     // differentiate wrt lambda
00126     //   d cos(m*lambda) = -m * sin(m*lambda)
00127     //   d sin(m*lambda) =  m * cos(m*lambda)
00128     //
00129     // so multiply terms by m in outer sum and swap sin and cos variables.
00130     //
00131     // differentiate wrt theta
00132     //  dV/dtheta = -u * dV/dt = -u * V'
00133     // here ' denotes differentiation wrt to t.
00134     //   d/dt (Sc[m] * P[m,m](t)) = Sc'[m] * P[m,m](t) + Sc[m] * P'[m,m](t)
00135     //
00136     // Now P[m,m](t) = const * u^m, so P'[m,m](t) = -m * t/u^2 * P[m,m](t),
00137     // thus
00138     //   d/dt (Sc[m] * P[m,m](t)) = (Sc'[m] - m * t/u^2 Sc[m]) * P'[m,m](t)
00139     //
00140     // Clenshaw recursion for Sc[m] reads
00141     //    y[k] = alpha[k] * y[k+1] + beta[k+1] * y[k+2] + c[k]
00142     // where alpha'[k] = alpha[k]/t, beta'[k] = c'[k] = 0.  Thus
00143     //    y'[k] = alpha[k] * y'[k+1] + beta[k+1] * y'[k+2] + alpha[k]/t * y[k+1]
00144     //
00145     // Finally, given the derivatives of V, we can compute the components of
00146     // the gradient in sphierical coordinates and transform the result into
00147     // cartesian coordinates.
00148 
00149     STATIC_ASSERT(L > 0, "L must be positive");
00150     STATIC_ASSERT(norm == full || norm == schmidt, "Unknown normalization");
00151     int N = c[0].nmx(), M = c[0].mmx();
00152 
00153     real
00154       p = Math::hypot(x, y),
00155       cl = p ? x / p : 1,       // cos(lambda); at pole, pick lambda = 0
00156       sl = p ? y / p : 0,       // sin(lambda)
00157       r = Math::hypot(z, p),
00158       t = r ? z / r : 0,            // cos(theta); at origin, pick theta = pi/2
00159       u = r ? max(p / r, eps_) : 1, // sin(theta); but avoid the pole
00160       q = a / r;
00161     real
00162       q2 = Math::sq(q),
00163       uq = u * q,
00164       uq2 = Math::sq(uq),
00165       tu2 = t / Math::sq(u);
00166     // Initialize outer sum
00167     real vc  = 0, vc2  = 0, vs  = 0, vs2  = 0;   // v [N + 1], v [N + 2]
00168     // vr, vt, vl and similar w variable accumulate the sums for the
00169     // derivatives wrt r, theta, and lambda, respectively.
00170     real vrc = 0, vrc2 = 0, vrs = 0, vrs2 = 0;   // vr[N + 1], vr[N + 2]
00171     real vtc = 0, vtc2 = 0, vts = 0, vts2 = 0;   // vt[N + 1], vt[N + 2]
00172     real vlc = 0, vlc2 = 0, vls = 0, vls2 = 0;   // vl[N + 1], vl[N + 2]
00173     int k[L];
00174     for (int m = M; m >= 0; --m) {   // m = M .. 0
00175       // Initialize inner sum
00176       real wc  = 0, wc2  = 0, ws  = 0, ws2  = 0; // w [N - m + 1], w [N - m + 2]
00177       real wrc = 0, wrc2 = 0, wrs = 0, wrs2 = 0; // wr[N - m + 1], wr[N - m + 2]
00178       real wtc = 0, wtc2 = 0, wts = 0, wts2 = 0; // wt[N - m + 1], wt[N - m + 2]
00179       for (int l = 0; l < L; ++l)
00180         k[l] = c[l].index(N, m) + 1;
00181       for (int n = N; n >= m; --n) {             // n = N .. m; l = N - m .. 0
00182         real w, A, Ax, B, R;    // alpha[l], beta[l + 1]
00183         switch (norm) {
00184         case full:
00185           w = real(2 * n + 1) / (real(n - m + 1) * (n + m + 1));
00186           Ax = q * sqrt(w * (2 * n + 3));
00187           A = t * Ax;
00188           B = - q2 * sqrt(real(2 * n + 5) / (w * (n - m + 2) * (n + m + 2)));
00189           break;
00190         case schmidt:
00191           w = real(n - m + 1) * (n + m + 1);
00192           Ax = q * (2 * n + 1) / sqrt(w);
00193           A = t * Ax;
00194           B = - q2 * sqrt(w / (real(n - m + 2) * (n + m + 2)));
00195           break;
00196         }
00197         R = c[0].Cv(--k[0]);
00198         for (int l = 1; l < L; ++l)
00199           R += c[l].Cv(--k[l], n, m, f[l]);
00200         R *= scale_;
00201         w = A * wc + B * wc2 + R; wc2 = wc; wc = w;
00202         if (gradp) {
00203           w = A * wrc + B * wrc2 + (n + 1) * R; wrc2 = wrc; wrc = w;
00204           w = A * wtc + B * wtc2 +    Ax * wc2; wtc2 = wtc; wtc = w;
00205         }
00206         if (m) {
00207           R = c[0].Sv(k[0]);
00208           for (int l = 1; l < L; ++l)
00209             R += c[l].Sv(k[l], n, m, f[l]);
00210           R *= scale_;
00211           w = A * ws + B * ws2 + R; ws2 = ws; ws = w;
00212           if (gradp) {
00213             w = A * wrs + B * wrs2 + (n + 1) * R; wrs2 = wrs; wrs = w;
00214             w = A * wts + B * wts2 +    Ax * ws2; wts2 = wts; wts = w;
00215           }
00216         }
00217       }
00218       // Now Sc[m] = wc, Ss[m] = ws
00219       // Sc'[m] = wtc, Ss'[m] = wtc
00220       if (m) {
00221         real v, A, B;           // alpha[m], beta[m + 1]
00222         switch (norm) {
00223         case full:
00224           v = 2 * real(2 * m + 3) / (m + 1);
00225           A = cl * sqrt(v) * uq;
00226           B = - sqrt((v * (2 * m + 5)) / (8 * (m + 2))) * uq2;
00227           break;
00228         case schmidt:
00229           v = 2 * real(2 * m + 1) / (m + 1);
00230           A = cl * sqrt(v) * uq;
00231           B = - sqrt((v * (2 * m + 3)) / (8 * (m + 2))) * uq2;
00232           break;
00233         }
00234         v = A * vc  + B * vc2  +  wc ; vc2  = vc ; vc  = v;
00235         v = A * vs  + B * vs2  +  ws ; vs2  = vs ; vs  = v;
00236         if (gradp) {
00237           // Include the terms Sc[m] * P'[m,m](t) and  Ss[m] * P'[m,m](t)
00238           wtc -= m * tu2 * wc; wts -= m * tu2 * ws;
00239           v = A * vrc + B * vrc2 +  wrc; vrc2 = vrc; vrc = v;
00240           v = A * vrs + B * vrs2 +  wrs; vrs2 = vrs; vrs = v;
00241           v = A * vtc + B * vtc2 +  wtc; vtc2 = vtc; vtc = v;
00242           v = A * vts + B * vts2 +  wts; vts2 = vts; vts = v;
00243           v = A * vlc + B * vlc2 + m*ws; vlc2 = vlc; vlc = v;
00244           v = A * vls + B * vls2 - m*wc; vls2 = vls; vls = v;
00245         }
00246       } else {
00247         real A, B, qs;
00248         switch (norm) {
00249         case full:
00250           A = sqrt(real(3)) * uq;       // F[1]/(q*cl) or F[1]/(q*sl)
00251           B = - sqrt(real(15)/4) * uq2; // beta[1]/q
00252           break;
00253         case schmidt:
00254           A = uq;
00255           B = - sqrt(real(3)/4) * uq2;
00256           break;
00257         }
00258         qs = q / scale_;
00259         vc = qs * (wc + A * (cl * vc + sl * vs ) + B * vc2);
00260         if (gradp) {
00261           qs /= r;
00262           // The components of the gradient in spherical coordinates are
00263           // r: dV/dr
00264           // theta: 1/r * dV/dtheta
00265           // lambda: 1/(r*u) * dV/dlambda
00266           vrc =     - qs * (wrc + A * (cl * vrc + sl * vrs) + B * vrc2);
00267           vtc = - u * qs * (wtc + A * (cl * vtc + sl * vts) + B * vtc2);
00268           vlc =   qs / u * (      A * (cl * vlc + sl * vls) + B * vlc2);
00269         }
00270       }
00271     }
00272 
00273     if (gradp) {
00274       // Rotate into cartesian (geocentric) coordinates
00275       gradx = cl * (u * vrc + t * vtc) - sl * vlc;
00276       grady = sl * (u * vrc + t * vtc) + cl * vlc;
00277       gradz =       t * vrc - u * vtc            ;
00278     }
00279     return vc;
00280   }
00281 
00282   template<bool gradp, SphericalEngine::normalization norm, int L>
00283   CircularEngine SphericalEngine::Circle(const coeff c[], const real f[],
00284                                          real p, real z, real a) {
00285 
00286     STATIC_ASSERT(L > 0, "L must be positive");
00287     STATIC_ASSERT(norm == full || norm == schmidt, "Unknown normalization");
00288     int N = c[0].nmx(), M = c[0].mmx();
00289 
00290     real
00291       r = Math::hypot(z, p),
00292       t = r ? z / r : 0,            // cos(theta); at origin, pick theta = pi/2
00293       u = r ? max(p / r, eps_) : 1, // sin(theta); but avoid the pole
00294       q = a / r;
00295     real
00296       q2 = Math::sq(q),
00297       tu2 = t / Math::sq(u);
00298     CircularEngine circ(M, gradp, norm, scale_, a, r, u, t);
00299     int k[L];
00300     for (int m = M; m >= 0; --m) {   // m = M .. 0
00301       // Initialize inner sum
00302       real wc  = 0, wc2  = 0, ws  = 0, ws2  = 0; // w [N - m + 1], w [N - m + 2]
00303       real wrc = 0, wrc2 = 0, wrs = 0, wrs2 = 0; // wr[N - m + 1], wr[N - m + 2]
00304       real wtc = 0, wtc2 = 0, wts = 0, wts2 = 0; // wt[N - m + 1], wt[N - m + 2]
00305       for (int l = 0; l < L; ++l)
00306         k[l] = c[l].index(N, m) + 1;
00307       for (int n = N; n >= m; --n) {             // n = N .. m; l = N - m .. 0
00308         real w, A, Ax, B, R;    // alpha[l], beta[l + 1]
00309         switch (norm) {
00310         case full:
00311           w = real(2 * n + 1) / (real(n - m + 1) * (n + m + 1));
00312           Ax = q * sqrt(w * (2 * n + 3));
00313           A = t * Ax;
00314           B = - q2 * sqrt(real(2 * n + 5) / (w * (n - m + 2) * (n + m + 2)));
00315           break;
00316         case schmidt:
00317           w = real(n - m + 1) * (n + m + 1);
00318           Ax = q * (2 * n + 1) / sqrt(w);
00319           A = t * Ax;
00320           B = - q2 * sqrt(w / (real(n - m + 2) * (n + m + 2)));
00321           break;
00322         }
00323         R = c[0].Cv(--k[0]);
00324         for (int l = 1; l < L; ++l)
00325           R += c[l].Cv(--k[l], n, m, f[l]);
00326         R *= scale_;
00327         w = A * wc + B * wc2 + R; wc2 = wc; wc = w;
00328         if (gradp) {
00329           w = A * wrc + B * wrc2 + (n + 1) * R; wrc2 = wrc; wrc = w;
00330           w = A * wtc + B * wtc2 +    Ax * wc2; wtc2 = wtc; wtc = w;
00331         }
00332         if (m) {
00333           R = c[0].Sv(k[0]);
00334           for (int l = 1; l < L; ++l)
00335             R += c[l].Sv(k[l], n, m, f[l]);
00336           R *= scale_;
00337           w = A * ws + B * ws2 + R; ws2 = ws; ws = w;
00338           if (gradp) {
00339             w = A * wrs + B * wrs2 + (n + 1) * R; wrs2 = wrs; wrs = w;
00340             w = A * wts + B * wts2 +    Ax * ws2; wts2 = wts; wts = w;
00341           }
00342         }
00343       }
00344       if (!gradp)
00345         circ.SetCoeff(m, wc, ws);
00346       else {
00347         // Include the terms Sc[m] * P'[m,m](t) and  Ss[m] * P'[m,m](t)
00348         wtc -= m * tu2 * wc; wts -= m * tu2 * ws;
00349         circ.SetCoeff(m, wc, ws, wrc, wrs, wtc, wts);
00350       }
00351     }
00352 
00353     return circ;
00354   }

00408   template
00409   CircularEngine SphericalEngine::Circle<true, SphericalEngine::full, 2>
00410   (const coeff[], const real[], real, real, real);
00411   template
00412   CircularEngine SphericalEngine::Circle<false, SphericalEngine::full, 2>
00413   (const coeff[], const real[], real, real, real);
00414   template
00415   CircularEngine SphericalEngine::Circle<true, SphericalEngine::schmidt, 2>
